is a charming town in the southwest of the province of West Flanders, close to the French Belgian border. On a surface of 11 933 ha it has 20 000 inhabitants and six communities: Proven, Krombeke, Haringe, Roesbrugge, Watou and Reningelst.

By train: From Lille Flandres station changing at Kortrijk.  Direct from Brussels main stations.

By car:   From the ports of Calais or Dunkerque, take the A16 East, turning off at junction 28 (A25 towards Lille). Get off at Junction 13 and follow the signs for Poperinge / Ypres (Ieper).
De Lijn buses are a good way of seeing the countryside around Poperinge.  The Belbus is a service which needs to be booked at least 2 hours before travelling.  See the De Lijn website (In Dutch).

value: Have a drink in the Palace, a hotel bar with more than 100 Belgian Beers.
Have a drink in one of the cafes on the Markt.
Take the Belbus North to In de Vrede, where they sell Westvleteren (allegedly the best beer in the world!)
Have a drink in the Hotel de Paix Bierhuis, over 120 Belgian Beers.
